thread.title: $1,000 reward offered in 2010 SW Portland homicide
thread.title_full: $1,000 reward offered in 2010 SW Portland homicide | OregonLive.com

author: Stuart Tomlinson | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: $1,000 reward offered in 2010 SW Portland homicide
text:
Five years to the day after a Southwest Portland homicide left a 50-year-old man dead from stab wounds, Crime Stoppers and the Portland Police Bureau announced a reward of up to $1,000 for information that leads to an arrest.
Portland police were called at about 8 a.m. Oct. 21, 2010, to a bus shelter at Southwest First Avenue and Sheridan Street to assist medical personnel. They found Donald Ray Polk, known as "Pokey" to his friends, dead in the shelter.
Polk is believed to have been homeless at the time of his death.
Portland detectives have learned that Polk was last seen alive about midnight at the 7-Eleven store at Southwest First Avenue and Arthur Street.
Anyone who saw Polk, knows where he was staying or may have any information about any incidents on Oct. 20 or Oct. 21 that may have led to his death are asked to call Portland homicide detectives at 503-823-0400.
Anyone with information on this case can also leave a tip on the Crime Stopper's website ; text CRIMES to 274637 and put 823HELP in the subject line; or call 503-823-4357. A Crime Stopper's app for iPhone and Android phones is also available online .
-- Stuart Tomlinson
stomlinson@oregonian.com
503-221-8313
